title: Slope of a Line
text: The slope of a line can be determined using two points $$(x_1,y_1)$$, $$(x_2,y_2)$$ by subtracting the y-values over the x-values: $$\frac{y_2-y_1}{x_2-x_1}$$.
speech: The slope of a line can be determined using two points ; open paren, x sub 1 comma y sub 1, close paren; , , open paren, x sub 2 comma y sub 2, close paren;  by subtracting the y-values over the x-values: ; fraction, y sub 2 minus y sub 1, over, x sub 2 minus x sub 1, end fraction; .

title: Slope of a Line
text: Substituting the points $$(-3,2)$$, $$(5,-2)$$, the slope is equal to $$\frac{\left(-2-2\right)}{5-\left(-3\right)}$$
speech: Substituting the points ; times, open paren, negative 3 comma 2, close paren; , , open paren, 5 comma negative 2, close paren; , the slope is equal to ; fraction, open paren, negative 2 minus 2, close paren, over, 5 minus negative 3, end fraction;

title: Slope of a Line
text: $$\frac{-4}{8}$$ can be simplified to get the slope of the line.
speech: , fraction, negative 4, over 8, end fraction;  can be simplified to get the slope of the line.
